texts.text: When I open my eyes...
I see a little seaside cabin in the distance.
It's small and cozy looking, standing there between the sea and the sky.
I can see a few people walking away from it.
With each step I take...
I remember it all.
What this place is.
Who's in that cabin.
What they are doing in there.
And who I am.
My steps feel lighter as I walk.
As I approach the cabin, the people who are leaving notice me.
For a moment they look surprised by my presence, but the surprise is quickly replaced with joy as they smile and greet me.
It's the Goddess!
I hear a little boy exclaim from behind of me, and I'm unable to keep myself from giggling at the thought.
I'm not a goddess.
I'm just a normal girl. Nothing unusual about me.
And...
I just came to see the man I love.
Walking in the opposite direction to the people leaving, I make my way to the front of the cabin.
He's looking at the book on his podium.
He could probably recite the contents of that book from memory if he wanted.
He never forgets a thing.
There are still a few people sitting on the chairs set up on the slightly worn wooden terrace. All that salt air must be rotting the wood.
One by one, they get up and leave.
All the people that notice me seem terribly surprised.
Is Kaito's description of me that striking?
Finally, the last person leaves the terrace.
The sound of the waves and the wind fill the air, bringing with them the cries of a few white birds.
The sounds envelop everything around us.
I take a step forward towards him.
Finally, I can reach out to Kaito.
I stare at the book by my hands as I wait for everyone to vacate the terrace.
After telling the story, I always stay there for a moment to reminisce about Yonagi.
When I tell her story, memories of her come rushing back to me, as intense as the moment I made them.
I keep gazing at the book until that overpowering image of her fades a little from my mind.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito.
But before my eyes is no mere image.
It's Yonagi, standing right in front of me.
Facing me with a smile I know very well.
She's looking straight at me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi... Is that you?
She nods, still beaming at me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It sure looks that way.
I approach her, tears beginning to form in my eyes.
We both walk towards the other until we meet halfway.
We clutch each other's hands in a joyful embrace.
This is the warmth I longed for for so long.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's you... I can feel your hands...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You've been telling everyone about me this whole time, haven't you?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's right.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: A boy called me a goddess just now.
I nod at her.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Didn't I tell you?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I said I'd make you the goddess of this world.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And I continued telling our story until it became true.
She shakes her head, her expression amused.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm not a goddess, silly.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm just a lone girl who loves you more than anyone in the world.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Weren't you the one who said I'll always be that girl for you?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.
Her smile lights up her whole face.
I'm smiling right back at her.
Just like back then...
We smile at each other, just as we did on the day we parted.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's good to have you back.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm home, Kaito.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm home!
We leave the cabin one morning and come out onto a mountain trail by the sea.
Yonagi and I walk down the gentle slopes with the wind at our backs.
Nothing like a little bit of hiking as you listen to the sound of the waves crashing in the distance.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I was watching all this time. Every time you told our story.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It was my duty for a reason. Those were fine days. Remembering our story every single day meant I never felt lonely.
She turns to face me and and gives a sweet smile.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I think you were a little too literal, though. Now everyone in the world knows every single thing about us. Like, every detail!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And that's why you're here right now.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Uh...
She flushes and hangs her head.
I can't help but smile at her bashfulness.
Her cheeks remain rosy as her smile softens somewhat.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's incredible, really. Now all the people of Shinjuku live here, right?
I nod in response.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Not just Shinjuku. All the people living underground in other countries too.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Do you think they're all happy?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah. Every day since I entered this world, I've seen the faces of the people who came to listen to our story.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Everyone seemed happy. We all have our worries, but they looked content with life.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's good to hear.
We walk along the trail toward the seashore.
The sound of our steps is accompanied by the waves.
We're holding hands as we go.
I can feel her warmth against my palm.
I hold her hand tightly, and she responds with a squeeze of her own.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito?
Yonagi casts her gaze down at the road.
I turn my head to her as we keep walking.
After a moment of silence, she looks up at me again and speaks.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: How's Professor Asuma?
I face the road ahead and ponder for a moment.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The researchers of Asuma Lab are still working in Shinjuku.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Izumo keeps me updated on their progress. There are some people who registered as gene donors after hearing my story.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The genetic sample pool collected at Asuma lab must be the most complete since humans began living underground.
Yonagi nods.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: There are some people with base will deficiency whose symptoms have stopped progressing.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Their lab has all the data on what kind of life the donors had, how they felt, and what kind of changes occurred in their bodies.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: They're not hurting for samples. I know he won't give up either. He'll find a cure.
Yonagi smiles again upon hearing this.
After studying my face for a moment, she nods.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We're just going our own ways and doing what we have to do. We don't talk, and I think it's better that way. It's fine.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm...
She nods, giving my hand a reassuring squeeze.
We keep walking, taking in the sound of the waves and the briny scent of the tide.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: This reminds me of the times we walked through the low side.
She says, turning her gaze up to me.
I let out a small chuckle and nod.
The beach comes into view before long.
The stony mountain path ends and we come out onto the sandy beach.
As we get there, we see a middle-aged couple up ahead who are taking a walk together just like us.
For some reason, the woman catches my attention.
She notices my gaze, smiles, and gives us a small nod by way of greeting.
Her face has some familiar vestiges. I remember it... from Asuma's memories.
I don't recognize the man beside her.
I stop for a moment and watch them walk away.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito?
Yonagi raises an eyebrow and cocks her head at me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Aren't we going?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah, yes.
We do what we need to do.
That means carrying one's burden as well.
We slowly approach the shore.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Whoa...
Once we make it close to the water, Yonagi slips out of her sandals and walks barefoot on the warm sand.
The pure white sand glimmers under the sunlight.
I catch sight of a white bird flying overhead.
It's a seagull.
It's a lot bigger than the bird that we found in the middle side all those years ago.
A few people are interspersed here and there across the beach.
They're spending their time in peace, be it enjoying the company of others, or laying on the sand and gazing at the clouds above.
Yonagi walks by the water's edge, the gentle waves dancing over her bare feet.
Yonagi walks by the shore, dipping her feet in the water.
The foam left in the wake of the waves glistens beneath the golden sunshine.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: The water feels so good.
Yonagi murmurs to herself.
I watch her from a few paces back, away from the water.
I watch the gentle breeze play with her hair.
Her fair skin and hair are as white as the pearly sands.
After a moment, she comes dashing over to me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Look at all this water!
She exclaims, extending her arms.
I smile, which Yonagi returns in kind.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And all this sky! It's so beautiful!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, they both are.
She nods again, her eyes sparkling with expectation.
Then she looks up at the sky.
Yonagi closes her eyes, takes a deep breath, and then breathes out.
The cry of a seagull rings far in the distance.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm so glad that everyone's world is so beautiful.
She says as she sits down beside me.
We're surrounded by the sound of the waves.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Everyone must have been thinking of you.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm?
I take Yonagi's hand in mine.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's why we can touch each other again.
Yonagi looks down at our interlocked hands.
Then she looks back up at me and smiles.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Everyone's so kind. This is such a kind world.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, you're right.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm sure there'll be many people who'll want to catch a glimpse of you from now on.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You're a goddess, remember?
She laughs and shakes her head.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Right. It's just a little... No, actually, it sounds like it could be fun.
She says as she rests her head on my chest.
We stay like that for a while, watching the placid waves come and go.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So the stories you wrote...
I'm the one who breaks the silence.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: They were all stories that ended in separation.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, back then I wrote them because I wanted to prepare myself for us to separate.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I just couldn't write any other conclusions to them.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But now...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Your own story didn't end in separation.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, that's right.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'd like those three to be happy too.
She raises her head and looks up at me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And I'd like to tell everyone about their stories, starting tomorrow.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Don't you think it'd be nice to give them happy epilogues?
Her smile widens as I finish speaking.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Epilogues, huh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Okay, I'll make them now.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Which one do you wanna hear first?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Rin's story, I guess.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Oh, Rin? After the end of her story, she...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And then they all made a very happy family together.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I guess I really wanted to have your baby in some way, actually.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I feel like a little of that wish spilled into Rin's story.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But Rin will be happy for the both of us in that respect.
Yonagi says, resting her head on my shoulder again.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm, that's right.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What's next?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm curious about what happened to Olivia.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Are you now? Well, I'm happy to inform you that she took life by the horns and found happiness. That's so very her, heheh.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So that rumor Kiki and friends were talking about...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Was it true?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Good question. Who knows...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Those who get in the way of love get to leave the stage in disgrace! That's how I like my stories, yes sir!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Well, I think those two could actually be really happy together.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Right? Maybe Will and the others can create their own stage. Something a little more open-minded for their time.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'd like to see that someday.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Okay, what's next?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I have to know how things with Sumomo and Kanna went.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And that you will! Sumomo got her happy ending too! Classy as ever, that girl.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm not sure I approve of the way Kanna was taught by his teacher.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kanna's a good, honest boy. He tends to be easily influenced by those around him.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, I suppose the responsibility will fall on his role model too. He really should try not to stick Spanish words into every other sentence.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It was Izumo who came up with that, though.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh, right. I almost forgot.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So, what's next?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So they're all happy now, huh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, they sure are.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Are you happy too?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm?
I turn to face her.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I suppose it all depends on you now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Uh, okay?
Yonagi looks up at me, her cheeks flushed.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I want to be your girl, always. We've always been family, but I'm also your wife. I don't want to ever forget that.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Do you think...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...you can make such a demanding goddess happy?
Her blush deepens as she looks up at me.
I wrap my arms around her shoulders and hold her closer.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Of course. That's my duty too.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I have high hopes for you.
For a while, we simply watch the sun dip below the horizon in silence.
The sea breeze grows colder and colder.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's getting chilly. Shall we head back?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm, good idea.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Izumo should be on her way back from her shopping trip too.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I-Izumo went shopping?
Yonagi's eyes become round as saucers.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: When you hear what's on the menu for dinner, it's gonna blow your socks right off.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Uh, porridge, right? Or not?
I simply laugh.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's join her. I'll send her our location data.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Izumo!
As soon as we rejoin the mountain trail from the beach, we find Izumo waiting for us.
Yonagi waves and calls her name as we approach.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Welcome home.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's nice to be back! You look so good!
Izumo merely nods.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Izumo, we're all going to be living together from now on. Can you take care of dinner?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Understood. I'll buy enough for three.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You're eating with us?!
Izumo nods.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What do we have on the menu for today?
Izumo eyes the bag dangling from her arm.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I purchased some flounder, so I plan to make carpaccio for the appetizer.
Yonagi gasps, her nostrils flaring from the shock.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Carpaccio?!

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Also caprese salad.
Now Yonagi's eyes look like they're about to pop right out of their sockets.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Caprese?!

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: The main dish is polpette in tomato sauce.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: The heck is that?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Izumo's been really into Italian food lately.
Izumo bobs her head.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Polpette is the Italian term for meatballs. It was in an encyclopedia I read as a kid, actually. Line 583 in the section on Western cuisine.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Can you stop it with the memory flexing?! No way I can remember any of that!
Izumo twitches for some reason.
Perhaps she's reacting to how similar Yonagi's mannerisms were to Azuki's just now.
We all head home together.
Izumo walks a few paces ahead.
Yonagi and I link arms and enjoy the cool sea breeze as we follow her.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I can't wait to try Izumo's cooking.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I will not disappoint.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ooh!
Izumo states, as a matter of fact.
Yonagi looks back and smiles at her.
The little seaside cabin comes into view.
This is the home we're gonna share from now on.
A place with a beautiful view of the vermilion sunset reflecting off the calm sea.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito?
I turn to Yonagi.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Do you love this world?
I feel the corners of my mouth raise as I give her a resolute nod.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, I love this world. From the bottom of my heart.
